Title: Children and Young People Education Mental Health Practitioner Programme, Health Education England- NHS/SoEPS/19.497
Description:
NHS South of England Procurement Services (SoEPS), acting on behalf of Health Education England (the Authority) are commencing a tender for the provision of a Children and Young People Education Mental Health Practitioner Programme.
Health Education England (HEE), in partnership with NHS England by 2020/21, commit to a significant expansion in access to high-quality mental health care for children and young people, with at least 70,000 additional children and young people each year receiving evidence-based treatment.

As part of the initiatives to support expansion there is a commitment to create a network of support for children and young people, and their educational settings (DHSC 2017). This includes establishing Mental Health Support Teams who will have the responsibility for delivering schools' overarching approach to providing mental health and wellbeing support for children and young people from January 2019. As part of the Mental Health Support Teams a new role called the Education Mental Health Practitioner (EMHP) is being established.

The implementation of the EMHP role will be underpinned by practitioners undertaking an accredited post graduate/graduate certificate programme of education and supervision in clinical practice. On successful completion of the programme, the learner will be equipped with the necessary skills, knowledge and capabilities to work as a qualified EMHP providing early intervention support for children and young people with mild to moderate mental health problems, and signposting to NHS and other appropriate services for further support.

This provision will split over 6 Geographic Lots.

The maximum value of this programme is £15,120,000 inclusive of any applicable VAT over a three year period across all 6 Lots.  The Authority reserves the right to extend the contracts by up to a further two years, to be determined on a Lot basis.

The first year of the programme will be up to £2,520,000 across all 6 Lots (£420,000 each Lot for tuition and supervision).

The funding is set at tuition costs of £11,500, inclusive of any applicable VAT, per learner in respect of the delivery of a postgraduate/graduate certificate completing the programme over a maximum period of 12 months.  The amount of £5,000, inclusive of any applicable VAT, will be available for training each Supervisor, with the expectation that supervisors can support up to two EMHP Trainees (1:2 Supervision trainer ratio). However, this may be adjusted for future cohorts as the training numbers increase.

Bidders are invited to access the procurement documentation at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/soepscommissioning
Please access the ITT procurement documents for further information.
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and the Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West
Attachments: Instructions for Registering on the SoEPS Commissioning Support In-tend Portal.pdf
Additional Text:
The deadline for submission of completed ITT submissions is Friday 26 April 2019 at 12:00pm (midday).  Late submissions will not be accepted.  The e-portal system will shutdown at 12:00pm and any un-submitted bids not registered to the system at this time will not be accepted.  Therefore, please submit in good time prior to the deadline date and time.

Project title: Children and Young People Education Mental Health Practitioner Programme, Health Education England - NHS/SoEPS/19.497, please access the ITT for all documents.  Should Bidders have any queries regarding registration or are having problems using the portal, they should contact the In-tend dedicated Supplier Helpdesk by calling 0845 557 8079 Monday to Friday (9am to 5pm) or email support@in-tend.co.uk

All communications should be made via the messaging function on the In-tend E-Tendering portal.  During the tender exercise the Contracting Authority requests that all communications are channelled through the e-portal system via the appointed procurement specialist on behalf of NHS South of England Procurement Services and not with the Contracting Authority itself. No Bidder, Bidder Member, or any of such Bidder's advisors, consultants or subcontractors may have ex parte communications with the Contracting Authority or any of their employees, advisors, contractors or consultants regarding the ITT, the Procurement, other than as expressly permitted in this ITT.

Title: Award of Service Level Agreement Every Child Counts programme (ECC) 2017/18
Description:
Award Notice - 
Service Level Agreement Every Child Counts programme (ECC) 2017/18
The School Improvement Service has delivered ECC intervention programmes to help schools to narrow gaps & impact on pupil progress since September 2010. This unique service provides training, accreditation & support for (SIA Primary Provider ). There are 5 ECC programmes which will be delivered this year: 1st Class@Number KS1 & 2; Success@Arithmetic-Number Sense & Success@Arithmetic-Calculation KS2/3;Talk4Number and 1st Class@writing (Pirate Writing Y3 & Dragon Hunters Y4/5). 
All are research-based & are aimed at different needs for different age groups. The cost of the resources are recovered from schools as part of the payment for the training package.   The programmes are having a significant impact on the achievement of pupils including  narrowing gaps in maths and writing is a particular focus currently.

Title: EVALUATION OF THE ACCELERATED POSTGRADUATE NURSE PILOT PROGRAMME
Description: The evaluation will be focused on the learning from the delivery of this educational programme and its potential application to future delivery of postgraduate nursing education. It will work with a network of stakeholders and the cohort of students distributed across separate learning disability and mental health nursing programmes at three universities; Edge Hill, University of Hertfordshire, and Kings College.  There were 40 students who commenced the programme - 30 studying Mental Health Nursing and 10 to become registered Learning Disability Nurses.  The cohorts of 10 are studying in London (Kings), Edge Hill (Edge Hill University), Hertfordshire and Southampton (both delivered through University of Hertfordshire).
